column1:
,TRUE,5,5,4,3,5 dRevan","2017-12-14T18:52:12.257Z","Pig City Teardown","

Angry Birds line is a weird theme for me. The sets were okay but the minifigures are bizarre. The minifigures are heading towards the Mega Blocks Minions type of figures but retaining the crisp Lego quality. The figures are not bad, in fact they are very movie accurate, but stand out amongst minifigures and mini dolls. Another problem is the articulation: the figures are one complete mold and unlike minifigures do not need to be assembled.
Pig City Teardown is a set that is very reminiscent of the Angry Birds game. The set has 4 figures, 2 builds, has 386 parts and retails for $49.99.

The build consists of the Pig City and a small catapult for the birds. The catapult is a simple build but has some cool parts. There are 2 1x4 printed tiles used to add texture and a flesh coloured bucket piece to hold a minifigure.
The whole premise of the set is to knock over parts of the Pig City which consists of a hot dog stand, zip line, payphone, chicken coop to hold the eggs, and a dynamite container.&nbsp

The small pay phone is a nice touch and besides that is trough containing four ice creams. Leading up to the steps is the hot dog stand. The build is good enough to place in a City with a few modifications. The hot dog bun accessory is an fantastic piece and makes the set worth it just for the piece. The stand also has a grill and condiment dispensers.

Joining the coop and the hot dog stand is a ramp containing more of the 1x4 wooden tiles. There are three balloons holding the ramp and when the balloons are hit, the ramp falls down bringing down the person on it.

The chicken coop is actually a decent build. It is enclosed on the sides by the 1x4 picket fence pieces, has a small entrance via a 2x2 yellow flag piece and has a light on top. The inside is spacious and contains 5 of the new egg pieces. The egg mold is another fantastic accessory. On top of the coop, is the mechanism for the zipline and a crank to hold the huge boulder. The zipline is a fun feature and has a set of lights on top and a boulder which holds the trigger to launch the zip line.&nbsp

The crank is part of another play feature. Holding the crank in place is a small fan which acts as the trigger. When hit, it falls back, activate the boulder which falls down on to the crate of dynamite below. The dynamite then falls over and you would expect an explosion. The dynamite stand has a 2x2 print of TNT which is a nice nod to the game. The tile only appears in this set and the Pig Castle set.&nbsp
The play features are fun and thoroughly entertaining. The build is cool but the base of the build is mediocre as 8 2x4 bricks are used to hold the whole thing together and give it some height.
- All Angry Birds are exclusive to their own set which is a cool thing I have never seen before Lego do.

1. Stella: The figure has a pink colour scheme with a plume of feathers on top. Her beak is made out of rubber which is a bit flimsy. Due to the plume, the figure gains extra height compared to other figures.
2. Red: The figure has a determined expression which is not bad but I would have preferred an angrier expression.
3. and 4. The pig are unnamed. One has a open mouthed aaah! face which is really funny and the other has a smug smile. Both are funny and adorable figures.

Overall: The set satisfies the price point and has enough figures for it as well. The parts are what I initially bought the set for like the hot dog bun piece and the egg piece. The build is not good as a displat piece but when taken apart is a treasure of fantastic parts. I bought the set at a 40% discount which more than justified the price for the set.
